abstract: The fees that cable and satellite operators pay local stations have produced big revenues, and some disputes. Now, networks want a share of these fees.
snippet: The fees that cable and satellite operators pay local stations have produced big revenues, and some disputes. Now, networks want a share of these fees.
lead_paragraph: Two weeks ago, KSFX, a Fox television station in the Ozarks, told its viewers that the Fox part was going away in the fall. The station said it would still show all of its local newscasts, but the station’s fans on Facebook had other concerns. What about “American Idol”? they asked. What about “Bones”?

headline.main: Networks Want Slices of a New Pie
headline.print_headline: Networks Want Slices Of a New Pie
